LanguageData.N_SleepStone.label: sleep stone
LanguageData.N_SleepStone.description: Sleep stone. Better than on the floor. Like Slab Bed.
LanguageData.N_DoubleSleepStone.label: sleeping stone double
LanguageData.N_DoubleSleepStone.description: Sleep stone. For two person. Better than on the floor. Like Slab Bed.
LanguageData.N_SleepStoneWL.label: sleep stone with leather
LanguageData.N_SleepStoneWL.description: Sleep stone with leather. Comparable with a standard bed. Can be considered as a slab bed.
LanguageData.N_DoubleSleepStoneWL.label: double sleep stone with leather
LanguageData.N_DoubleSleepStoneWL.description: Sleep stone with leather. For two person. Comparable with a standard bed. Can be considered as a slab bed.
LanguageData.N_SleepStoneWF.label: sleep stone with fur
LanguageData.N_SleepStoneWF.description: Sleep stone with fur. Incredibly comfortable.
LanguageData.N_DoubleSleepStoneWF.label: double sleep stone with fur
LanguageData.N_DoubleSleepStoneWF.description: Sleep stone with fur. For two person. Incredibly comfortable.
LanguageData.N_RoyalStoneBed.label: chief's sleep stone
LanguageData.N_RoyalStoneBed.description: A sleeping stone worthy of a leader. Extremely comfortable.
LanguageData.NeandertalStool.label: rock for sit
LanguageData.NeandertalStool.description: The stone for sit. Convenient when compared with the floor.
LanguageData.NeandertalDiningChair.label: comfy stool
LanguageData.NeandertalDiningChair.description: The comfy stool. It's comfortable. It's a stool.
LanguageData.NeandertalCouch.label: couch
LanguageData.NeandertalCouch.description: A large, soft, comfy seat. For feasts and conversations.
LanguageData.NeandertalEndTable.label: night light
LanguageData.NeandertalEndTable.description: Place by the bed. More than four - meaningless. Can be used as a torch.
LanguageData.NeandertalEndTablePoor.label: stone nightstand
LanguageData.NeandertalEndTablePoor.description: Bedside table with a small light. For those who can't afford a night light.
LanguageData.NeandertallTableSmoolPoor.label: table usual (1x3)
LanguageData.NeandertallTableBigPoor.label: table usual (1x5)
LanguageData.NeandertallTableSmool.label: durable table (1x3)
LanguageData.NeandertallTableBig.label: durable table (1x5)
LanguageData.TribalHeart.label: heart of the tribe
LanguageData.TribalHeart.description: Big bonfire. Lots of light. Lots of warmth.
LanguageData.N_RockColumn.label: rugged column
LanguageData.N_RockColumn.description: A column capable of holding a roof. Does not block sight or movement and looks quite nice.
LanguageData.N_RockThrone.label: chief's throne
LanguageData.N_RockThrone.description: A massive chair, designed for a dignity-focused psycaster to sit and meditate. Reigning on a throne is a form of meditation that builds up psyfocus. For dignity psycasters, more impressive meditation thrones and thronerooms increase the rate of psyfocus gain.
LanguageData.N_RockThrone.comps.CompAssignableToPawn_: Throne ownership requires a person with a royal title.
LanguageData.N_NeandertalRockBrazier.label: flat brazier
LanguageData.N_NeandertalRockBrazier.description: Flat brazier. For the chief's room.
LanguageData.NeandertalDrape.label: neandertal ornamentation
LanguageData.NeandertalDrape.description: Rock painting applied to a leather canvas. For the chief's room.
LanguageData.N_IceBlock.label: ice floe
LanguageData.N_IceBlock.description: Ice floe. Covered with straw. Ice was used until the 20th century to preserve food.
LanguageData.NeandertalBlackboard.label: stone blackboard
LanguageData.NeandertalBlackboard.description: Blackboard. As we understand, the Neanderthals did not have schools. Therefore, this object is nothing more than an imitation.
LanguageData.NeandertalSchoolDesk.label: neandertal school desk
LanguageData.NeandertalSchoolDesk.description: School desk. As we understand, the Neanderthals did not have schools. Therefore, this object is nothing more than an imitation.
LanguageData.NeandertalGrave.label: stone barrow
LanguageData.NeandertalGrave.description: Tumulus. Stones are stacked in the form of a hill over the body of the deceased.
LanguageData.NeandertalDoorPoor.label: rotten door
LanguageData.NeandertalDoorPoor.description: Divides rooms. Do not think that this door can protect something.
LanguageData.NeandertalDoor.label: megalithic door
LanguageData.NeandertalStove.label: cooking stone
LanguageData.NeandertalStove.description: The fire is kindled under a large flat stone. Usually bread cakes are baked on such stones.
LanguageData.N_ButcherLog.label: butcher log
LanguageData.NeandertalCrib.label: tribal hammock crib
LanguageData.NeandertalCrib.description: Baby bed, in the form of a hammock. But, to be more precise, it is more like a bag.
LanguageData.N_sharpstones.label: pile of sharp stones
LanguageData.N_sharpstones.description: Small storage of working tools, prehistoric period. Increases work speed when placed near a workbench.
LanguageData.NeandertalBrewerySpot.label: neandertal brewery spot
LanguageData.NeandertalBrewerySpot.description: A work to mix wort for beer production.
LanguageData.NeandertalReliquarySmool.label: small simple reliquary
LanguageData.NeandertalReliquarySmool.description: A ceremonial building that protects and displays a relic. Relics are ancient objects venerated by some cultures, belief systems, or religions.
LanguageData.NeandertalReliquary.label: sturdy simple reliquary
LanguageData.NeandertalReliquary.description: A ceremonial building that protects and displays a relic. Relics are ancient objects venerated by some cultures, belief systems, or religions.
LanguageData.NeandertalStylingStation.label: neandertal styling station
LanguageData.NeandertalStylingStation.description: People can use this to change their look.
LanguageData.N_WoodForImpalement.label: wood for impalement
LanguageData.N_WoodForImpalement.description: Wooden stake for holding and displaying corpses. This horrifying sight inspires horror and disgust to onlookers. This is a particularly brutal and effective way to terrorize slaves.
